content: In Greek mythology, what substance was said to grant immortality when consumed, often associated with the gods on Mount Olympus?

In Greek mythology, the substance said to grant immortality when consumed, often associated with the gods on Mount Olympus, is known as **ambrosia**. Ambrosia was considered the food or drink of the gods, and it was believed to sustain their immortal nature. It was often depicted as a fragrant, sweet substance that conferred longevity and divine qualities upon those who partook of it. In various myths, mortals who tasted ambrosia would be granted immortality or other supernatural abilities.
